title: Wright Brothers National Memorial: Kids & Youth
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Kids & Youth             Kids & Youth         Fourth-graders and their families can visit over 2,000 federal lands for free with this pass.   Wright Brothers National Memorial invites kids to pick up a junior ranger booklet at the front desk, investigate the site along with the activities, and be sworn in as a junior ranger once they've learned all about the Wright brothers. Every Kid in a Park This initiative allows every fourth-grade student and her or his family to visit over 2,000 federal lands—such as national parks, national forests, and national wildlife refuges—for free! For additional information, and to print off a paper pass, visit everykidinapark.gov. Bring your paper pass to Wright Brothers National Memorial and you can exchange it for a more durable and wearable plastic access pass.
